conclusion: Determine which container (E, F, or G) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles labeled A, B, C, and D.
A (Blue Baffle): The liquid flows downward and to the left.
Liquid from A will likely reach container E.
B (Green Baffle): The liquid flows downward and slightly to the right.
Liquid from B will likely reach container F.
C (Blue Baffle): The liquid flows downward and slightly to the right.
Liquid from C will likely reach container F.
D (Orange Baffle): The liquid flows downward and to the right.
Liquid from D will likely reach container G.
Consider the baffle angles and directions.
The direction of each baffle guides the liquid flow. The angle and position determine which container it will reach.
Container E will receive liquid from baffle A.
Container F will receive liquid from baffles B and C.
Container G will receive liquid from baffle D.
Final Answer: Liquid from A flows into E, liquid from B and C flows into F, liquid from D flows into G.
